page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: Westbury lies on the A422 an east/west route linking Stratford, Banbury, Brackley, Buckingham and Bedford. It is 2\ miles from Brackley and 5 miles from Buuckingham. In 1931 there were few cars and no buses. Farmers and gentry possessed horses and carriages but the ordinary villages walked. A railway line just to the south with a station a mile away at Fulwell was invaluable for transporting milk and farm supplies.When it closed in 1960 buses saved the villagers a walk. Now that most families own a car, the older villagers depend on lifts and just 3 buses a day to Brackley. On market day a special bus extends to Buckingham.School buses fetch young children to Westbury and take older ones to middle and secondary schools in Buckingham.Bicester 10,Banbury 12 and Bletchley 18miles have railways.
